I hope this email finds you well.

One of our vehicles was involved in an accident in March 2025, and we sent it to the PAL garage for repair under our insurance policy. We have now been informed by PAL that the vehicle has been declared a total loss by the insurance company.

I am attaching the vehicle’s Mulkiya and the Police Report for your reference. Could you please guide us on the next steps we need to follow regarding this matter.

Your prompt assistance in this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support

SHIJIN JOSEPH​​​​

Dear Shijin,

 

Please find below total loss approval and details for your perusal. 

 

Important Note: Any vehicle that have been deemed total loss must be removed by GIG from the garage within 5 working days. As soon as you have collected your personal items and license plates from the vehicle, please email us a confirmation.

Important Note: Any vehicle that have been deemed total loss must be removed by GIG from the garage within 5 working days. As soon as you have collected your personal items and license plates from the vehicle, please email us a confirmation. 

If you don't, there will be a penalty and parking costs will be deducted from your settlement amount. GIG will not be liable for any fines/charges/actions levied by the garage or Municipality.

 

This Offer is Valid for only 60 days from the date of issue.

 

If there is any delay from the vehicle owner in completing the transaction including the ownership transfer of vehicle in the name of GIG Insurance company, there will be a deduction of AED 25/- per day applicable on final settlement after the free storage period as mentioned above is expired, which is towards the storage expenses incurred in keeping the vehicle in storage yards. 

 

GIG shall not be responsible for any damages or deterioration occurred to the vehicle because of parking in an open storage exposed to environmental conditions.

 

 

 

Dear Sir / Madam ,

 

Trust you are doing fine. 

 

We have received your motor claim approved as total loss. Please find attached Total Loss Docs for your reference and action. May we request you to kindly forward us the final signed settlement letter + your bank liability outstanding letter (if the car is under mortgage) + Emirates ID copy in order to process the payment.

 

 

STEPS TO BE FOLLOWED FOR TOTAL LOSS CLAIM SETTLEMENT:

We have received your motor claim approved as total loss. Please find attached Total Loss Docs for your reference and action. May we request you to kindly forward us the final signed settlement letter + your bank liability outstanding letter (if the car is under mortgage) + Emirates ID copy in order to process the payment.

 

 

STEPS TO BE FOLLOWED FOR TOTAL LOSS CLAIM SETTLEMENT:

 

1) Kindly sign the settlement letter (as an acceptance) once you have gone through the same, scan & email it back to us. Kindly be sure that the name on the letter is spelled correctly  as this name will appear as Payee name on the cheque.

2) We will arrange to forward the claim file for payment & the payment process will be completed in 10 working days. Please note that the cheques are  Accounts Payee cheque only, not cash cheque.

3) Please contact the garage to collect your personal belongings & the number plates from the vehicle.

     Kindly confirm once you have collected your personal belongings and numbers plates to enable us to remove the vehicle from the garage asap. Failure to confirm might result to Municipality penalties and parking charges.

 

4) kindly visit the traffic department  in the Emirate where you register your vehicle along with following: 

 

Both number plates of the car 

Registration card of the vehicle 

Your passport and driving licence copy 

Arabic Cancellation Letter/NOC  (Copy attached herewith)

GIG Trade  Licence copy (Copy attached herewith)

Both number plates of the car 

Registration card of the vehicle 

Your passport and driving licence copy 

Arabic Cancellation Letter/NOC  (Copy attached herewith)

GIG Trade  Licence copy (Copy attached herewith)

 

 

5)At the traffic department mention that you need to transfer the vehicle ownership  to  “AXA INSURANCE (GULF) BSC” or “GULF INSURANCE GROUP (GULF) B S C CLOSED)” as transferee. The traffic department will issue a “Vehicle ownership certificate” stating that the ownership of the vehicle has been transferred from your name to AXA/GIG name.

 

 

We encourage you to process the vehicle transfer manually only at the traffic dept .

 

 

For Abu Dhabi and other Northern Emirates registered vehicle, please transfer “locally to Dubai” and use the below details :

 



 

 

 

 

 

 

6) We will update you as soon as the settlement chq is ready for collection. 

7) Upon receiving our confirmation for chq collection, you may visit our GIG Abu Dhabi Office/ Dubai Outsource City Office - hand over the original Vehicle Ownership Certificate + transfer fee invoice + spare keys and collect the settlement cheque. 

 

 

 

If the vehicle is financed by a bank, Please find below 2 options:

 

*	Contact your bank and obtain the outstanding bank liability letter . Email us the outstanding bank liability letter mentioning your claim reference number. The issuance of bank cheque will take 10 working days hence kindly check the validity of your outstanding loan letter.

*	Contact your bank and obtain the outstanding bank liability letter . Email us the outstanding bank liability letter mentioning your claim reference number. The issuance of bank cheque will take 10 working days hence kindly check the validity of your outstanding loan letter.

You will be informed by the Motor Total Loss claims team once the bank cheque is ready for collection. While collecting the bank cheque, a guarantee cheque for the same amount is required to be submitted to us from your end. Upon submission of your guarantee chq, the bank cheque issued from GIG Insurance will be released to you and you may kindly deposit the same with your bank and obtain a release letter from the bank stating that there is no loan outstanding on the vehicle.

 

*	You may settle the outstanding loan directly to your bank and provide us the confirmation once the loan is cleared so we may issue the full total loss compensation amount under your name. The payment process will be completed in 10 working days. Please note that the cheques are Accounts Payee cheque only, not cash cheque.
*	RTA WILL ONLY ALLOW TRANSFER OF OWNERSHIP WHEN THE LOAN IS CLEARED 

 

Once the loan is cleared, please proceed to step 3. 

 

 

3) Visit the traffic department (Tasjeel or Shamil, where you register your vehicle) along with following: 

 

Original Release letter from the Bank  (if any or if required by the traffic Department)

Number plates of the car 

Registration card of the vehicle 

Your passport and driving licence copy 

Our Trade Licence copy - attached

Arabic Letter - attached

Original Release letter from the Bank  (if any or if required by the traffic Department)

Number plates of the car 

Registration card of the vehicle 

Your passport and driving licence copy 

Our Trade Licence copy - attached

Arabic Letter - attached

 

4) At the traffic department fill the form mentioning “GIG INSURANCE (GULF) BSC” or “AXA INSURANCE (GULF) BSC” as transferee. The traffic department will issue a “No Plate certificate” or Vehicle Possession certificate

5) We shall update you as soon as the balance chq (if any) is ready for collection. 

6) Visit our GIG DOZ/ ABU DHABI Office and hand over the original No Plate certificate and spare key and the balance cheque (if any) will be handed over to you OR the guarantee cheque provided by you will be returned to you. 

 

 

 

 

How is TOTAL LOSS Calculated?

 

The calculation of the compensation is based after deduction of the Depreciation Percentage of 20% from the insured value, and taking into account the fraction of insurance period (i.e., the proportion of the period from the commencement date of the insurance period to the date of the accident to the total insurance period).

 

(Sum insured x 20% x No of days from the commencement date till accident date) / policy period  : 

The depreciation rate for total loss accident is made as per the instructions & guidelines from the Insurance Authority - CENTRAL BANK (Regulators)

 

 

For any queries regarding reimbursement for the below expenses:  kindly email:

 

Motorclaims.ml@gig-gulf.com <mailto:Motorclaims.ml@gig-gulf.com> 

 

 



 

 

Regards,

6) Visit our GIG DOZ/ ABU DHABI Office and hand over the original No Plate certificate and spare key and the balance cheque (if any) will be handed over to you OR the guarantee cheque provided by you will be returned to you.

 

 

 

 

How is TOTAL LOSS Calculated?

 

The calculation of the compensation is based after deduction of the Depreciation Percentage of 20% from the insured value, and taking into account the fraction of insurance period (i.e., the proportion of the period from the commencement date of the insurance period to the date of the accident to the total insurance period).

 

(Sum insured x 20% x No of days from the commencement date till accident date) / policy period  :

The depreciation rate for total loss accident is made as per the instructions & guidelines from the Insurance Authority - CENTRAL BANK (Regulators)
